newsitem.title: USA: Muni credit spreads widen in past week -- Delphis.
newsitem.headline: Muni credit spreads widen in past week -- Delphis.

text.p: After tightening for several weeks, credit spreads among long-term municipal bonds widened 10 basis points in the week ended Thursday, Delphis Hanover Corp. said Friday.
The credit spread between Aaa-rated and Baa-rated 30-year bonds widened 10 basis points to 70 basis points.
The credit spreads for one-year and 10-year maturities, however, remained unchanged at 65 basis points each.
The high-grade municipal yield curve held mostly steady for the week.
The spread between one-year and 30-year bonds in the triple-A category was unchanged for the second week in a row at 175 basis points. The Baa yield curve steepened 10 basis points to 180.
Average yields on one-year, Aaa-rated municipal bonds rose five basis points for the second consecutive week to 3.70 percent. Baa-rated one-year bonds also rose five, to 4.35 percent.
In the intermediate sector, yields on Aaa-rated 10-year bonds rose five basis points to 4.75 percent, and Baa-rated ten-years rose five to 5.40 percent.
Munis outperformed the Treasury market over the week.

The yield on the government long bond rose 10 basis points to 6.78 percent, after falling 10 in each of the three prior weeks. Thirty-year Aaa-rated municipal yields, meanwhile, rose just five basis points over the same period to 5.45 percent.
Thirty-year, Aaa-rated munis yielded 80.4 percent of the Treasury long bond at the close Thursday, compared to 80.8 percent the week before.
Yields were up 15 basis points on 30-year, Baa-rated bonds, moving to 6.15 percent.
